When you’re thinking of buying a household appliance or any electronic equipment, how do you decide which one is the best choice for you and your family? Here are a few tips that I’ve learnt over the years as a professional gadget shopper.
VIEW OUR RANGE OF QUALITY APPLIANCES AND ELECTRONICS
Talk to your friends and family
It’s a good idea to ask people you trust which devices, brands and features they prefer because it will help you think about what you want from your gadget and what you want to avoid. Just be careful not to take their advice to heart. Conflicting advice can be confusing, and in the end, what you buy is your choice, not theirs.
Write it down
Once you’ve decided which features you’d like your gadget to have, write them down in two columns, one for needs and one for wants. After you’ve done this, you should have a good idea of which features are the important ones and which would just be nice to have.
Talk to your friends and family
It’s a good idea to ask people you trust which devices, brands and features they prefer because it will help you think about what you want from your gadget and what you want to avoid. Just be careful not to take their advice to heart. Conflicting advice can be confusing, and in the end, what you buy is your choice, not theirs.
Write it down
Once you’ve decided which features you’d like your gadget to have, write them down in two columns, one for needs and one for wants. After you’ve done this, you should have a good idea of which features are the important ones and which would just be nice to have.
Take measurements
If you’re buying a gadget to fit a certain space in your home or handbag, it’s important to know the maximum size your new gadget should be – otherwise, it just won’t fit! Remember to measure the height, width AND depth of your space and to think about any moving parts that might need extra space.
Extra tip: If you’re buying a large appliance, you should also measure the doorways leading from outside your home to your appliance’s final position.
Take measurements
If you’re buying a gadget to fit a certain space in your home or handbag, it’s important to know the maximum size your new gadget should be – otherwise, it just won’t fit! Remember to measure the height, width AND depth of your space and to think about any moving parts that might need extra space.
Extra tip: If you’re buying a large appliance, you should also measure the doorways leading from outside your home to your appliance’s final position.
Consider your shopping options
Decide whether you’d like to shop online or if you want to visit a few physical stores first. At HomeChoice, you can do either since we have an online store and showrooms all over South Africa. This is great because it means you can see the product in real life and choose to order it there and then or later at home. Wherever you decide to shop, make sure the retailer has a reputation for good-quality gadgets and a returns policy (just in case).
Extra tip: It can be risky buying gadgets from across the globe because some countries use different plug shapes and outlets with stronger/weaker electrical currents. It’s generally safer to buy gadgets locally and avoid these complications.
Consider your shopping options
Decide whether you’d like to shop online or if you want to visit a few physical stores first. At HomeChoice, you can do either since we have an online store and showrooms all over South Africa. This is great because it means you can see the product in real life and choose to order it there and then or later at home. Wherever you decide to shop, make sure the retailer has a reputation for good-quality gadgets and a returns policy (just in case).
Extra tip: It can be risky buying gadgets from across the globe because some countries use different plug shapes and outlets with stronger/weaker electrical currents. It’s generally safer to buy gadgets locally and avoid these complications.
Get a warranty or guarantee
If you see that a product has a warranty or guarantee, you can be sure that either the manufacturer or retailer can vouch for the product’s quality. If you have to pay a little more for a product with a warranty or guarantee, I would definitely consider that a wise purchase for the long run.
Buy budget-friendly
Lastly, it’s wise to only buy what you can afford. With credit cards and HomeChoice offering the option to pay over several months, you might find you can afford to buy something more expensive than you expected, but you should always make sure that whatever you pay fits comfortably into your monthly budget.
Extra tip: You could get some extra cash for your new gadget by selling an old one you no longer use, making your purchase even more affordable!
I hope these tips come in handy for any gadget shopping you do in future. Remember to save this page as a favourite on your browser so that you can easily find it again when you need it.
